It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1826 Nov. 1
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the Wednesday November 1, 1826 session of court, during which a case over the rights to a slave woman was heard. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.head: Wednesday 1st Nov. November 1826
div.p:
The court met according to adjournment Present their honors, John Martin,
Jas. James Daniel, Jas. Brown & Walter S. Adair

Sarah West
vs.
Jno. John Walker Sn. Senior
& Katy five Killer
Try rights for a negro woman Quaity & her two children.
The Court decide that Mrs. West is entitled to the negro woman Quaity only.
